verses.verse: My son <S%H1121><s%>, attend <S%H7181><s%> unto my wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and bow <S%H5186><s%> your ear <S%H241><s%> to my understanding <S%H8394><s%>:
That you may regard <S%H8104><s%> discretion <S%H4209><s%>, and that your lips <S%H8193><s%> may keep <S%H5341><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.
For the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a strange woman <S%H2114><s%> drop <S%H5197><s%> as a honeycomb <S%H5317><s%>, and her mouth <S%H2441><s%> is smoother <S%H2509><s%> than oil <S%H8081><s%>:
But her end <S%H319><s%> is bitter <S%H4751><s%> as wormwood <S%H3939><s%>, sharp <S%H2299><s%> as a twoedged <S%H6310><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%>.
Her feet <S%H7272><s%> go down <S%H3381><s%> to death <S%H4194><s%>; her steps <S%H6806><s%> take hold <S%H8551><s%> on hell <S%H7585><s%>.
Lest you should ponder <S%H6424><s%> the path <S%H734><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>, her ways <S%H4570><s%> are moveable <S%H5128><s%>, that you can not know them <S%H3045><s%>.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> me now therefore <S%H1121><s%>, O you sons, and depart <S%H5493><s%> not from the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
Remove <S%H7368><s%> your way <S%H1870><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from her <S%H7126><s%>, and come not near the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house <S%H1004><s%>:
Lest you give <S%H5414><s%> your honor <S%H1935><s%> unto others <S%H312><s%>, and your years <S%H8141><s%> unto the cruel <S%H394><s%>:
Lest strangers <S%H2114><s%> be filled <S%H7646><s%> with your wealth <S%H3581><s%>; and your labors <S%H6089><s%> be in the house <S%H1004><s%> of a stranger <S%H5237><s%>;
And you mourn <S%H5098><s%> at the last <S%H319><s%>, when your flesh <S%H1320><s%> and your body <S%H7607><s%> are consumed <S%H3615><s%>,
And say <S%H559><s%>, How have I hated <S%H8130><s%> instruction <S%H4148><s%>, and my heart <S%H3820><s%> despised <S%H5006><s%> reproof <S%H8433><s%>;
And have not obeyed <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my teachers <S%H3384><s%>, nor inclined <S%H5186><s%> my ear <S%H241><s%> to them that instructed me <S%H3925><s%>!
I was almost <S%H4592><s%> in all evil <S%H7451><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the congregation <S%H6951><s%> and assembly <S%H5712><s%>.
Drink <S%H8354><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> out of your own cistern <S%H953><s%>, and running waters <S%H5140><s%> out of <S%H8432><s%> your own well <S%H875><s%>.
Dont let your fountains <S%H4599><s%> be dispersed <S%H6327><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%>, and rivers <S%H6388><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> in the streets <S%H7339><s%>.
Let them be only your own <S%H2114><s%>, and not the strangers' with you.
Let your fountain <S%H4726><s%> be blessed <S%H1288><s%>: and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> with the wife <S%H802><s%> of your youth <S%H5271><s%>.

Let her be as the loving <S%H158><s%> doe <S%H365><s%> and pleasant <S%H2580><s%> roe <S%H3280><s%>; let her breasts <S%H1717><s%> satisfy <S%H7301><s%> you at all times <S%H6256><s%>; and be you ravished <S%H7686><s%> always <S%H8548><s%> with her love <S%H160><s%>.
And why will you <S%H1121><s%>, my son, be ravished <S%H7686><s%> with a strange woman <S%H2114><s%>, and embrace <S%H2263><s%> the bosom <S%H2436><s%> of a stranger <S%H5237><s%>?
For the ways <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> are before <S%H5227><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and he ponders <S%H6424><s%> all his goings <S%H4570><s%>.
His own iniquities <S%H5771><s%> shall take <S%H3920><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> himself <S%H8551><s%>, and he shall be held with the cords <S%H2256><s%> of his sins <S%H2403><s%>.
He shall die <S%H4191><s%> without instruction <S%H4148><s%>; and in the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of his wickedness <S%H200><s%> he shall go astray <S%H7686><s%>.
